conversation.content: OH MY GOD OH MY GOD I just got the BEST idea ever we should totally start a band RIGHT NOW!
Whoa whoa whoa, slow down there! Um, I love the enthusiasm, actually, but you know, starting a band takes a bit more planning than just deciding on a whim.
But but but I already [hesitantly] picked out stage names—well, I guess mine would be Lightning Fingers and yours could be, sort of, Thunder Voice!
Lightning Fingers and Thunder Voice? That's... surprisingly not terrible actually. Though I should probably mention I haven't touched an instrument since middle school band class.
WHO CARES we'll [cough] figure it out as we go I'M BUYING A KEYBOARD TODAY!
Hold on, [mumbling] before you drop serious cash on instruments, maybe we should figure out what kind of music we'd even play? Rock, pop, electronic, jazz fusion?
ALL OF THEM! We'll be genre-bending pioneers! Revolutionary! GAME-CHANGING!
So that's, honestly, incredibly ambitious, but er, most successful bands actually start by mastering one style before branching out into experimental territory.
You're thinking too small! We need to EXPLODE onto the scene!
Exploding onto the scene sounds great in theory, but realistically we'd need to practice, write songs, find a drummer, maybe a bassist, book venues...
I can play drums with my FEET while playing keyboard—uh, I saw it on YouTube once, kind of looks easy, basically anyone can multitask!
Hmm, playing drums with your feet while... I mean, that's definitely something, but the thing is, coordination like that takes years to develop properly.
Years schmears! We're young! We're ALIVE! Uhh, like, who needs years when you have RAW PASSION—anyway, I'm calling music stores RIGHT NOW!
Your energy is absolutely infectious, I'll give you that. But before you max out your credit card, what if we started with something simpler, like writing a song together?
WRITING! YES! I have [deep pitch] seventeen notebooks FULL of lyrics about pizza and heartbreak and SPACE TRAVEL!
Seventeen notebooks? Ah, that's really impressive actually, though it's just that mixing pizza with heartbreak and space travel might be a challenging thematic combo.
Challenging is GOOD! You know, umm, all the best artists were told they were crazy—right so, we're basically already halfway to GENIUS STATUS!
I admire your complete lack of self-doubt, seriously. Most people spend years paralyzed by fear before even attempting something creative.
Fear is for people who DON'T—well, [enunciating every word] honestly have seventeen notebooks of pizza space heartbreak lyrics—actually I'M TEXTING EVERYONE WE KNOW ABOUT OUR BAND!
Wait wait wait! Err, before you announce us to the world, basically shouldn't we at least, I think, decide on an actual band name first?
